conclusion: Understanding ion implantation process in chip manufacturing.
Ions are accelerated from the ion source and enter the velocity selector horizontally.
Velocity selector has electric field directed vertically upwards and magnetic field directed outward perpendicular to the paper.
Electric force on the ion is qE (upward), and magnetic force is qvB (downward). For the ion to pass through straightly, these forces should balance: qE = qvB, so v = E/B.
Only ions with velocity v = E/B will pass through the selector without being deflected.
Ions enter the magnetic analyzer, which is a quarter-circular ring with inner radius R1 and outer radius R2.
Magnetic field in the analyzer is B, outward perpendicular to the paper.
Path of the ion in the magnetic field is a circle with radius R given by mv²/R = qvB, so R = mv/qB.
Substituting v = E/B into R = mv/qB gives R = mE/qB².
Path in the magnetic analyzer is a quarter-circle from M to N.
Radii R1 and R2 might be used to select ions within a certain range of masses or charges.
Ions enter the deflection system, which also has electric and magnetic fields.
Electric field in the deflection system is directed outward perpendicular to the paper, and magnetic field is directed vertically upwards.
Fields are in the same cube with side length L, and the bottom of the cube is L units above the wafer.
When no fields are applied in the deflection system, ions are injected vertically onto point O on the wafer.
Deflection angles are small, allowing use of small angle approximations: sinα ≈ tanα ≈ α and cosα ≈ 1 - (α²)/2.
Considering the magnetic field effect in the deflection system.
Magnetic force on the ion is qvB, directed perpendicular to both v and B.
If ion enters deflection system vertically downward, magnetic force would be horizontal, perpendicular to both v and B.
Magnetic field in deflection system is directed outward perpendicular to the paper, and electric field is directed vertically upwards.
If ion is moving downward, magnetic force would be qvB directed horizontally.
